page.title: 01Surveyed Area
page.content: The twelve kilometre area is situated midway between Newark and Lincoln.The main trunk road which runs nearby is the Fosseway _ the original Roman road which ran from Lincoln to Cirencester. The area has the border between North Notts and Lincolnshire running through it.This is very much a country area with the predominent "industry",being agriculture. The population is low with only two small villages within the area.People who are not connected with farming commute to the larger towns,Lincoln,Newark and Nottingham. Buildings comprise old stone cottages with modern late 20th century housing. There are two Norman churches.The main Lincoln,Nottingham railway runs through the surveyed area and this provides the facility of a raiway station at Swinderby.
